page.title: 18Farming in Dunnington
page.content: The predominant land cover of this area is farming. The land is comparatively level, reaching a maximum spot height of 31.7 m.above sea level at Kimberlow Hill. The soil is Grade 3, primarily producing cereals, winter wheat, barley and oil seed rape. Grass is grown on the poorer soils, whilst the better soils bordering on Grade 2 produce sugar beet and potatoes. Being low lying some of the land is liable to flood. {Clock Farm }_ acreage 417 <about average for _ 42 acres grass the area> _ 50 acres potatoes, _ 60 acres sugar beet, _ 28 acres peas, _ 237 cereal <winter wheat,barley> Employs father, 1 son full time, 1 son part time, 2 other full time employees
